snippet: All of the talk about birth control and abortion laws seems to have had little effect on the ways women are voting for the two leading Republican candidates, Mitt Romney and Rick Santorum, at least according to exit polls in the primaries.
abstract: All of the talk about birth control and abortion laws seems to have had little effect on the ways women are voting for the two leading Republican candidates, Mitt Romney and Rick Santorum, at least according to exit polls in the primaries.

byline.original: By KATE PHILLIPS and ALLISON KOPICKI

headline.main: Female Voters and the Republican Primary
